website_summaries.verdict: The best budget light meter with a simple set up process and control interface. Great for beginners.
pros: Light meter body is small enough to fit inside bags or pockets when not in use
Control buttons are easy to reach and push with one hand to switch to different settings
cons: Difficult to use accurately in low light conditions
Comes with a small learning curve to master

customer_reviews.title: Even the science professors were amazed at the accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely surprised by the ease of use and accuracy of this Light meter. I use it for my orchids both at home and at the college where I teach. Even the science professors were amazed at the accuracy. Very portable and well made. It arrived in 2 days as promised. Well packaged. With this simple tool I was able to determine that I needed to change the lighting conditions for some of my plants. Great for the hobbyist!
customer_reviews.author: Yankee Belle

customer_reviews.title: Good meter, told me what I wanted to know.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for one purpose. To see if one LED bulb that burns 16 hours a day had dimmed any in a year compared to sister bulb that is hardly ever on. Meter showed virtually no difference between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Gilstrap

customer_reviews.title: Calculate actual Lumen output of flashlights
customer_reviews.text: I used this device to calculate the true Lumens coming out of these CRE1 flashlights. BY focusing the lamp right on the white sensor, one can compute the lumen output by multiplying the LUX reading by the area of the white sensor. ...a pretty closed approximation. This problem was to determine the veracity of an advertised 5,000 lumen output coming from a flashlight .
customer_reviews.author: Carl23

customer_reviews.title: Locks up if turned on in no or low light...
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked well when new, but now does not work when turned on in low light... just locks up. The only way to get it to work is to shine a bright light on it. Replaced batteries, no difference... so rather useless to me. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond B

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: It seems to do the job, and quality and robustness seem good enough. The instructions are in Chinese English but comprehensible if awkward. It took me a few minutes to figure out how to work the multi-function buttons (e.g. "Hold" also cycles functions). You'll need to but a 9 volt battery. It does not come with one. I would recommend this meter if all you need is the basics and you don't want to pay a lot. Being able to actually know objectively how much light my plants are getting has been a real help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for available light photography and video / film - doesn't do built-in calculations but reads out in footcandles
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a video / photo light meter. Use the footcandles reading for incident readings, and use a table like the one in the ASC manual to calculate your exposures based on ISO and shutter speed / shutter angle.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Uken

customer_reviews.title: It's been great for having an objective measurement to decide where to ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems accurate - I checked against my phone's light meter app, and while the numbers I got were different, they were consistently different. It's been great for having an objective measurement to decide where to put houseplants. Like every other reviewer, I like that it has a cover for the sensor dome, but I wish it was tethered to the meter itself so I don't have an extra piece of plastic to lose. I'm very happy with this purchase, and that small gripe would not prevent me from purchasing again or recommending to other houseplant enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy
customer_reviews.text: I likely received a used product, which means it would be a fraudulent sale.. Straight out of the (amateurish) box, it has numerous scratches and smudges on on the screen and elsewhere. Also, the meter can't stay on. I can see why it was returned by the previous user. Reinforces the saying "You get what you pay for." I'm demanding a refund.
customer_reviews.author: news reader

customer_reviews.title: Works great - great value
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anything to compare it to, but I have a few professional lights where this lux meter measured the same as the lights claimed. Seems very accurate. Built from plastic, which is fine. I'm not sure about battery life, though it seems anything with 9v lasts a long time :) Takes a 9v battery, I already had some amazon batteries.
customer_reviews.author: The Deckers

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: The meter is of very low quality. I would not recommend this product. It does work but and might be used to determine different light levels, but the meter is not accurate. It can not be calibrated. I did not expect a lab quality lux meter for this price but I did expect a little more.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF B.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate. Nothing else matters.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to use it for quick validation of lighting design. After getting measurements which were fairly consistently ~40-50% below my calculated values, I bit the bullet and bought a more expensive Extech meter with NIST certificate. The Extech was giving readings quite close to the calculated (expected) values. For the record I attempted new batteries. I was unable to locate any info on how to calibrate the meter.
customer_reviews.author: Slapy

customer_reviews.title: Usable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is an affordable light meter. You get what you pay for. The only complaint is that when a constant light source is over it the read out changes almost constantly + or - 4. This is good enough to get a good idea about the level of lighting in that spot.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Return the item.
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item. It was not accurate. I Broke two separate battery Terminals on two separate batteries trying to unplug and replace. This was done was because the unit did not seem to work properly. Maybe I just received a faulty unit.
customer_reviews.author: SFS

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and has sensitive accuracy
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive light meter was a pleasant surprise. Very easy to use and has sensitive accuracy. I use in hydroponics but could be used for many different purposes. Was using in minutes after an on time delivery
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it works pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: This is about the cheapest light meter I could find on AZN and I have to say that it was well packaged, NOT USED like some older reviews said, and works pretty well. I can not guarantee the accuracy because I have no way to test that, however, it is perfect for comparing different bulbs and light fixtures for brightness.
customer_reviews.author: The Unknown Geek

customer_reviews.title: Study the lighting in your study area maximize learning
customer_reviews.text: Tricky to get stable readings but once you get the hang if it very helpful in my studies. Needed to brighten up the room for fighting eye strain, and found out better bulb choices for my LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Checking light in my wifes grow Tent to put the lights in proper hight to the plants. Works great. I feel I got a good deal for a good price. Works fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: William Hartsock

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be pretty accurate but I don't have proper tools to say for sure. The quality isn't the best though honestly. The hold button doesn't work properly so most the time when I press it turns device off. I think the button is sticking but I don't know for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Zoyla Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Useful to meet OSHA standards
customer_reviews.text: For the price you're getting a good light meter that does the trick. I bought this for our office to ensure we're at the minimum light levels per OSHA. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised, not having a separate sensor head is an annoyance BUT still useable. My 10000 lux Chinese flashlight registers only 650 lux, my Crimson Trace laser sight registers 1200 to 750 lux and my signal/rescue laser shows extreme 120,000 lux. works great.
customer_reviews.author: Sober Poster

customer_reviews.title: The hold button doesn't hold half the time
customer_reviews.text: The hold button doesn't hold half the time. I could never figure out rhyme or reason. Sending it back. Instead I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this light meter
customer_reviews.text: Works incredibly well. I am using it in footcandles mode to measure light requirements of orchids. Easy to use and seems very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: jselt53

customer_reviews.title: For video stuff i guess
customer_reviews.text: I thought i could use this for photography to measure how many Fstops it give out and such. Hahahah Should have done my research.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working well for our application of choosing new lighting for classrooms and offices
customer_reviews.author: SueL

customer_reviews.title: I use it non-professionally
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it for professional use. I wanted to check out the Lux in my living room and in my bedroom to see if I needed a bit more light. I did add more light it works great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for maximizing lux to plant canopies and inexpensive too!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rego

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Become my fundamental tool for evaluating tungsten vs led car headlight assemblies.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos Martins

customer_reviews.title: keep the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Not super intuitive. I can't tell how accurate. Seems like a good deal for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: 40something

customer_reviews.title: needed a light meter for my YouTube channel so I bought this one!
customer_reviews.text: it works very well and is easy to use. It does the job and does it well!
customer_reviews.author: Hunsakers Home Hacks

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 seasons of VERY limited use, the liquid crystal display becomes non-functional (only partial digits). Considering how little use this device underwent, I would have expected better--at any price. Seller did not respond to email.
customer_reviews.author: Bello Stronzo

customer_reviews.title: This meter is very easy to use and seems reliable
customer_reviews.text: This meter is very easy to use and seems reliable. You have to be careful that the white meter sensor is facing directly up if you are attempting to get light measurements from above. We ordered several of these to use in an Ecology course, and our students didn't have any trouble. One of the units came with a malfunctioning screen, but the seller Leaton Direct was extremely prompt and helpful in swapping it out for a new one. I agree with the other reviews about this being a much more affordable option than other.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Which LED bulb is best for your use?  Use this to know!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to determine the best LED bulb to use. The claims of brighntess on LED bulb ads a packages seem to have been written by the White House press corps. You have to fact check which bulb is the brightest independently.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, bargain price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a DIY'er and I can't say how accurate the measurements are, but I wanted to do "before" and "after" measurements while I was working on installing new lights. This was perfect for making unbiased quantitative measurements for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: azapplewhite

customer_reviews.title: Great for household lighting evaluations.
customer_reviews.text: Got it to help a 90 year old relative evaluate and upgrade lighting for various activities. It did exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: True to description, handy and portable
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, portable, easy to used and works as expected. I got this to measure light conditions for my plants.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: so you fumble around to find the hold feature AGAIN POOR DESIGN, remendy is to make the head rotatable ...
customer_reviews.text: DESIGN PROBLEM when taking a reading you have to point the unit at the light source , so now the display is facing the light source , SO you cant read the display , so you fumble around to find the hold feature AGAIN POOR DESIGN , remendy is to make the head rotatable Ray M
customer_reviews.author: Ray M

customer_reviews.title: Good for a very basic cheap luxmeter for non critical use
customer_reviews.text: Good for a cheap luxmeter. Point off because the protective cover for the sensor is not tethered or hinged to the meter, so it will probably get lost, and it's a hassle to keep track of it while using the meter. Better design would be a hinged or sliding cover that can't get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It's a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated that it isn't calibrated but for the price I can live with that. It seems to be accurate and easy to use. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Seabeck Person

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good inexpensive meter. Used for checking required light levels in workplace.
customer_reviews.author: J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Understanding the product
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok but a little more info on using and operating would be nice. I like to understand the product
customer_reviews.author: Scott W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for checking light levels in the egress paths of a commercial building. Quick and just as accurate as my colleagues $600 meter.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Simple tech, economic solution
customer_reviews.text: works as designed. helped figure out if some plants were getting enough light.
customer_reviews.author: HonDuh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was very helpful to measure light levels in my office.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Not for photography
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a really nice meter and works as described. However, if you are looking for a light meter for photography, this isn't it. You might either by a vintage one (if you don't want to spend a lot of money) or pay more for a photography light meter
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: Low priced and works well. Very light and protable.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Provides easy to read values of light levels. Great for setting room levels for video recording.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Mcgregor

customer_reviews.title: Cheap!!!
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is completely off. It worked for about one week and that is it! Had to purchase a different brand .
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised about how well the meter worked and its construction quality. Quite a bargain for the money. It's too soon to evaluate battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This helped me to find the best, brightest location indoors to overwinter some frost tender plants.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Little harder to use than I expected. I would think that the sensor should point away from the readout so you could read it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, simple and seems to work...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and seemingly accurate...taking the calibration on faith, but I'm just looking for the order of magnitude and first significant digit from this. Passes the common-sense test when I tried it. Simple and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Cox

customer_reviews.title: Quite sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for educational use in my planetarium. It works as described and is more sensitive than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item worked well for comparing the relative brightness of different sources of light. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... is my very first light meter and I'm not disappointed. It works very well and reads accurately
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first light meter and I'm not disappointed. It works very well and reads accurately. It shipped faster than expected, and was packaged very well. This is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: W.Morris

customer_reviews.title: FOR THE PRICE ITS PRETTY USEFUL
customer_reviews.text: LUX IS NOT LUMEN S... ITS 1/10TH A LUMEN.. SO U HAVE TO DIVIDE DON'T FORGET..:)
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick H.

customer_reviews.title: I am hoping to return it because it worked once ...
customer_reviews.text: I am hoping to return it because it worked once and then would shift to foot candle readings except for with a large multiplier that didn't seem correct.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good, simple functioned tool, gives me a really close reading for general readings, without spending significant dollars
customer_reviews.author: Rex W.

customer_reviews.title: fool proof at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great priced item and practically foolproof, I knew how to operate without reading the instructions but when I did read them I found out that I could do more with this than expected
customer_reviews.author: thomas a.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. For this price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: A. Michael

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: cheap made, low quality and it does not come with batteries
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, straight forward to use and works without hiccups or issues. What's nice to like? For the price - can not be beat!
customer_reviews.author: rhi

customer_reviews.title: Product as advertised, delivered on schedule. Unfortunately I ...
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised, delivered on schedule. Unfortunately I don't have a more accurate device to test the validity of readings on this unit, but it appears to be working as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: light meter
customer_reviews.text: This instrument is very easy to use and works great.You can check amount of light in any area like the library for reading etc.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, my students use it regularly to measure light in the courtyard at school

customer_reviews.title: A must have for lighting !
customer_reviews.text: The luxmeter has become a great help in giving me correct lighting values . It's easy to read . Small enough it is not a bulky burden during setup .

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: It looks great I didn't think that it wasn't going to have batteries but I just went bought some batteries and it is perfect thank you

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to see what power lux I was getting. From my lec light. Seems to work as this is my first lux meter. I'm happy with my purchase and will give it 5 stars because it deserves it

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This Lux Meter works very good. Excellent quality and very fast shipping. I like it so much.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Simple to use. Has a cover for the sensor. Remove the cover and turn it on. Wish the cover stayed on, feel like I would lose it, but no big deal.

customer_reviews.title: Corded sensor rules I bought a orange one on amazo a month after this one literally night and day this one is in a box of useless stuff don’t b cheap ull regret I did also ...

Corded sensor rules I bought a orange one on amazo a month after this one literally night and day this one is in a box of useless stuff don’t b cheap ull regret I did also appreciate those who write good revues to save people grief money and time I use these revues almost every purchase and write them good or bad crappy stuff people should no about joe from mt.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: It's a great, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: It's a great, inexpensive, tool for determining light intensity in an indoor garden. I just wish there were some inexpensive PAR meters to go with it.

I come to realize I need a light meter that sync to my camera or may need to look at more tutorials. Not quite sure how to use this for my photo shoots as of right now. TBD if I will increase this rating. Other than that it does work and shipping was right on time!

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely surprised to see the quality of this meter considering its low price. It is easy to operate, seems very durable, and when comparing the readings against a more expensive meter one of my coworkers has, the readings were the same. I would definitely recommend this product. The seller shipped my item in a timely fashion and followed up with an e-mail to make sure I was satisfied.

product_meta.title: Leaton Digital Luxmeter/Digital Illuminance Light Meter lux meter with LCD Display(Range: 0.1~200,000 Lux Luxmeter, 0.01~20,000Fc)
product_meta.description:
This instrument is simple and easy to operate, 4 ranges to be switchable. This pocket design makes it convenient and portable, easy to use and to get a precision reading. 
Specifications: 
Display: Large LCD characters display 
Range: 0.1~200,000Lux, 0.01~20,000Fc 
Resolution: 0.1Lux / 0.01Fc 
Accuracy:±4% 
Measurement speed: 2 times / second 
Units: Lux & Fc 
Hold function, Auto range & Manual range 
Auto Power OFF: After approx.15 minutes 
Power Supply: One 9V battery 
Low power of battery detecting 
Operating Environment: 14 to 122℉(-10 to 50℃), 10%~90%RH 
Dimensions: 145 X 67 X 32mm (5.7" x 2.6" x 1.3") 
Weight: 170g (6.0 oz)
feature_bullets: The digital light meter will allow you to measure the lighting in an area
The digital light meter uses a 9V battery(not included); Accurate up to 200,000Lux +/- 5%
Resolution: 0.1Lux / 0.01Fc, Accuracy:±4%,Measurement speed: 2 times / second,Units: Lux & Fc
Hold function, Auto range & Manual range,Auto Power OFF: After approx.15 minutes
Low power of battery detecting,Operating Environment: 14 to 122℉(-10 to 50℃), 10%~90%RH

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars244 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
